Create categorical variables template

Source: R/template_categorical_variables.R
template_categorical_variables.Rd

Use this function to extract the unique categorical variables of a data table and return for user supplied definitions. Instructions for editing this template.

template_categorical_variables(
      path,
      data.path = path,
      write.file = TRUE,
      x = NULL
    )

Arguments

path

(character) Path to the metadata template directory.
data.path

(character) Path to the data directory.
write.file

(logical; optional) Whether to write the template file.
x

(named list; optional) Alternative input to template_categorical_variables(). Use template_arguments() to create x.

Value

catvars_*.txt The tab delimited categorical variable template, where * is the table name from which the variables were extracted. This file is written to path unless using x, in which case the template is added to /x/templates/catvars_*.txt.

Details

template_categorical_variables() knows which columns of a table are categorical based on their definition under the class column of the attributes_*.txt template.

An existing categorical variables template will not be overwritten by subsequent calls to template_categorical_variables().

Character encoding of metadata extracted directly from the tables are converted to UTF-8 via enc2utf8().

Examples

# Initialize data package directory for template_categorical_variables()
file.copy(
  from = system.file('/examples/pkg_255', package = 'EMLassemblyline'),
  to = tempdir(),
  recursive = TRUE
)
#> [1] TRUE

# Set working directory
setwd(paste0(tempdir(), '/pkg_255'))

# View directory contents (NOTE: catvars_*.txt files don't exist)
dir('./metadata_templates')
#> [1] "abstract.txt"            "additional_info.txt"    
#> [3] "attributes_decomp.txt"   "attributes_nitrogen.txt"
#> [5] "custom_units.txt"        "intellectual_rights.txt"
#> [7] "keywords.txt"            "methods.txt"            
#> [9] "personnel.txt"          

# Template categorical variables
template_categorical_variables(
  path = './metadata_templates',
  data.path = './data_objects'
)
#> Templating categorical variables ...
#> catvars_decomp.txt
#> catvars_nitrogen.txt
#> Done.

# View directory contents (NOTE: catvars_*.txt files exist)
dir('./metadata_templates')
#>  [1] "abstract.txt"            "additional_info.txt"    
#>  [3] "attributes_decomp.txt"   "attributes_nitrogen.txt"
#>  [5] "catvars_decomp.txt"      "catvars_nitrogen.txt"   
#>  [7] "custom_units.txt"        "intellectual_rights.txt"
#>  [9] "keywords.txt"            "methods.txt"            
#> [11] "personnel.txt"          

# Rerunning template_categorical_variables() does not overwrite files
template_categorical_variables(
  path = './metadata_templates',
  data.path = './data_objects'
)
#> Templating categorical variables ...
#> catvars_decomp.txt already exists!
#> catvars_nitrogen.txt already exists!
#> Done.

# Clean up
unlink('.', recursive = TRUE)
